keymaps.name: Colemak for PC
keymaps.description: Colemak is based on QWERTY, but it places the most frequent letters under the strongest fingers. This is the PC version.

keymaps.name: Colemax
keymaps.description:
A special layout to be used with a base layer of Colemak configured on the PC.
This layout has some unique assignments of Mod, Fn, and Mouse layers to make it compatible with Max' AutoHotKey script Maxmax.ahk. Beware that on this layout, the Mod function is mapped to the Capslock position (Mouse key) as a secondary function. Primary is Backspace (normal for Colemak layouts).

keymaps.name: Dvorak for PC
keymaps.description: The Dvorak keyboard layout was designed with the goal of maximizing typing efficiency. This is the PC version.

keymaps.name: Nummax
keymaps.description:
A special layout to be used together with Colemax. This implements a NumLock layer for this layout.
This layout has some unique assignments of Mod, Fn, and Mouse layers to make it compatible with Max' AutoHotKey script Maxmax.ahk. Beware that on this layout, the Mod function is mapped to the Capslock position (Mouse key) as a secondary function. Primary is Backspace (normal for Colemak layouts).

keymaps.name: Nummax 2
keymaps.description:
A special layout to be used together with Colemax. This implements an alternative NumLock layer for this layout.
This layout has some unique assignments of Mod, Fn, and Mouse layers to make it compatible with Max' AutoHotKey script Maxmax.ahk. Beware that on this layout, the Mod function is mapped to the Capslock position (Mouse key) as a secondary function. Primary is Backspace (normal for Colemak layouts).

keymaps.name: Pause
keymaps.description:
A special layout to be used with a base layer of Colemak configured on the PC.
This layout has some unique assignments of Mod, Fn, and Mouse layers to make it compatible with Max' AutoHotKey script Maxmax.ahk. Beware that on this layout, the Mod function is mapped to the Capslock position (Mouse key) as a secondary function. Primary is Backspace (normal for Colemak layouts).

keymaps.name: QWERTY for PC
keymaps.description: QWERTY is the mother of all layouts. This is the PC version.

macroActions.command:
set leds.fadeTimeout 300
clearStatus
set module.trackpoint.baseSpeed 0
set module.trackpoint.speed 0.7
set module.trackpoint.xceleration 0.7
set module.touchpad.navigationMode.mouse caret
set module.keycluster.navigationMode.mouse caret
set secondaryRole.defaultStrategy advanced
set secondaryRole.advanced.timeout 250
set secondaryRole.advanced.timeoutAction secondary
set secondaryRole.advanced.triggerByRelease 1
set secondaryRole.advanced.safetyMargin 50
call keepAlive

setVar r 20
setLedTxt 0 CMX
loop: delayUntil 250
ifKeymap CMX repeatFor r loop
ifNotKeymap CMX final setLedTxt 1 CMX

ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 '::C'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 ':C:'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 'C:M'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 ':M:'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 'M:X'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 ':X:'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 ':::'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 '::C'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 ':CM'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 'CMX'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 300 ':::'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 300 'CMX'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 300 ':::'
ifKeymap CMX setLedTxt 200 'CMX'
setLedTxt 600 MSE
clearStatus

macros.name: Go to UHK site in browser

macroActions.command:
setVar r 6
startloop:
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "`-'"
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "---"
ifKeymap --- repeatFor r startloop
keepalive:

ifNotKeymap --- goTo final
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "---"
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "}--"
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "-}-"
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "--}"
ifNotKeymap --- goTo final

ifNotKeymap --- goTo final
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "---"
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "--{"
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "-{-"
ifKeymap --- setLedTxt 200 "{--"
ifNotKeymap --- goTo final
ifKeymap --- goTo keepalive

final: 
setLedTxt 800 "[-]"
setLedTxt 200 "[\\]"
setLedTxt 200 "[|]"
setLedTxt 200 "[/]"
setLedTxt 200 "[-]"
setLedTxt 200 "[\\]"
setLedTxt 200 "[|]"
setLedTxt 200 "[/]"
setLedTxt 200 "[-]"
setLedTxt 200 "[*]"
setLedTxt 200 "|_|"

tapKeySeq keypadPlus keypadPlus keypadPlus keypadPlus keypadPlus space B E G I N space keypadPlus keypadPlus keypadPlus keypadPlus keypadPlus space space enter
tapKeySeq keypadMinus keypadMinus np6 np6 keypadMinus 2 space space enter
tapKeySeq keypadMinus keypadPlus np6 np6 keypadMinus LS-2 space space enter
tapKeySeq keypadMinus keypadAsterisk np6 np6 keypadMinus RA-2 space space enter
tapKeySeq keypadMinus keypadSlash np6 np6 keypadMinus RAS-2 space space enter
tapKeySeq keypadMinus keypadMinus keypadMinus keypadMinus keypadMinus space E N D space keypadMinus keypadMinus keypadMinus keypadMinus keypadMinus space space enter

ifShift goTo shiftMaxtend
ifAlt goTo altMaxtend
ifSecondary advancedStrategy goTo secondaryaction

primaryaction:
tapKey backspace
setLedTxt 500 '<--'
break

secondaryaction:
setLedTxt 0 'MAX'
holdLayer mod
setLedTxt 1 'MAX'
break

shiftMaxtend:
setLedTxt 0 '<--'
suppressMods holdKey backspace
ifNotPlaytime 300 final setLedTxt 300 '<--'
setLedTxt 1 '<--'
break

altMaxtend:
setLedTxt 0 'DEL'
suppressMods holdKey delete
ifNotPlaytime 300 final setLedTxt 300 'DEL'
setLedTxt 1 'DEL'
break

ifShift goTo shiftMaxtend
//ifAlt final suppressMods holdKey delete
setLedTxt 0 MAX
holdLayer mod
ifReleased setLedTxt 1 MAX
ifInterrupted break
ifPlaytime 300 break
tapKey backspace
setLedTxt 500 <--
break
shiftMaxtend:
setLedTxt 0 <--
suppressMods holdKey backspace
ifReleased setLedTxt 1 MAX

holdLayer mod
ifInterrupted break
ifPlaytime 300 break
toggleLayer mod

holdLayer previous
ifInterrupted break
ifPlaytime 300 break
unToggleLayer

ifSecondary final holdLayer mouse
tapKey space
resolveNextKeyId

ifShift goTo shiftTab
ifAlt final holdKey tab
ifSecondary advancedStrategy goTo secondaryaction
primaryaction:
tapKey tab
setLedTxt 500 '->|'
break
secondaryaction:
setLedTxt 0 NUM
holdLayer fn5
setLedTxt 1 NUM
break
shiftTab:
setLedTxt 0 '|<-'
holdKey tab
ifNotPlaytime 350 final setLedTxt 350 '|<-'
setLedTxt 1 '|<-'
printStatus
